Product.ProdName: Renal Nutrition DPG: CSR Webinar Series – Session #1 Recorded
Product.Content:
First Topic
Early CKD (Conservative Management of Chronic Kidney Disease)
by Marianne Hutton, RD CSR CDE

Increase awareness of:

  • Risk facts and prevalence of CKD
  • Clinical practice guidelines and nutrition interventions that may delay progression of CKD
  • Conservative management of pre dialysis (18 years or older)


Second Topic
Nutrition and Hemodialysis
by Paula Frost, RD, CSR, LD

  • Evaluation of Nutritional Status
  • Lab Tests for HD nutritional Assessment
  • Development and Implementation of Interventions
  • Putting it all together in a Case study

Webinar Viewing Tips (pdf)

Webinar Viewing Tip:  The webinar is a very large file and will take a while to load.  DO NOT click the view button more than once while the file is loading or you may use an additional download.  You are allowed 5 downloads/webinar purchased.  Also, even if you do not view the entire webinar recording when you access the file, it still will be considered 1 view or 1 download used. From the date of purchase, you have 1 year to use/view the CSR recorded webinars. The recorded webinars can be viewed 5 times each within the 1 year period.

Note: Tests at the end of the webinar are only for personal comprehension use and NOT for CPEU credit.

Product.ProdName: Renal Nutrition DPG : CSR Webinar Series – Session #2 Recorded
Product.Content:
First Topic
Acute Kidney Injury
by Ann Beemer Cotton, MS, RD, CNSD

  • Diagnostic Criteria for AKI
  • Classification/Staging System for AKI
  • AKI Etiologies
  • MNT in AKI Stages 1-3 and Recovery
  • Case Studies

Second Topic
Nutrition in Pediatric Renal Care
by Cynthia J. Terrill, RD, CSR, CD

  • Causes of Renal Failure in pediatric patients
  • Conservative Treatment of Choice
  • Renal Failure in Children
  • Nutritional Goals for pediatric renal patient
  • Barriers in achieving optimal growth and nutritional status
  • Nutritional Assessment
  • Nutritional issues associated with CKD in Children
  • Diet modification for Adolescents with CKD
  • Case Studies

Webinar Viewing Tips (pdf)

Webinar Viewing Tip:  The webinar is a very large file and will take a while to load.  DO NOT click the view button more than once while the file is loading or you may use an additional download.  You are allowed 5 downloads/webinar purchased.  Also, even if you do not view the entire webinar recording when you access the file, it still will be considered 1 view or 1 download used. From the date of purchase, you have 1 year to use/view the CSR recorded webinars. The recorded webinars can be viewed 5 times each within the 1 year period.

Note: Tests at the end of the webinar are only for personal comprehension use and NOT for CPEU credit.

Product.ProdName: Renal Nutrition DPG : CSR Webinar Series – Session #3 Recorded
Product.Content:
First Topic
Defining, Recognizing and Achieving  Adequate Hemo and Peritoneal Dialysis Dosages
by Faith Tootell, MS. RD, CSR, FADA

  • Identify three proposed changes in the K/DOQI Clinical Practice
  • Guideline for HD Adequacy-2006
  • Define 2 distinct types of PD membranes and determine which type of PD is the most suitable option for each.
  • Describe clinical features of patients w/both adequate and insufficient delivered dialysis dosages.

Second Topic
Realizing Peritoneal Dialysis
by Faith Tootell, MS. RD, CSR, FADA

  • Identify 3 different PD therapy methods
  • Correctly estimate the total daily intake of kcal from glucose absorbed from pts’ dialysate solution
  • Identify 3 complications of PD and corresponding interventions to rectify them
  • K/DOQI nutritional recommendations for pts on PD

Webinar Viewing Tips (pdf)

Webinar Viewing Tip: 
The webinar is a very large file and will take a while to load.  DO NOT click the view button more than once while the file is loading or you may use an additional download.  You are allowed 5 downloads/webinar purchased.  Also, even if you do not view the entire webinar recording when you access the file, it still will be considered 1 view or 1 download used. From the date of purchase, you have 1 year to use/view the CSR recorded webinars. The recorded webinars can be viewed 5 times each within the 1 year period.

Note: Tests at the end of the webinar are only for personal comprehension use and NOT for CPEU credit.

Product.ProdName: Renal Nutrition DPG : CSR Webinar Series – Session #4 Recorded
Product.Content:
First Topic
Nutrition & Transplant
by Carolyn Cochran, MS, RD/LD, CDE

  • Pre-Transplant Evaluation & Education
  • Pre-transplant interventions
  • Immunosuppressive  Medications
  • Acute Care Post Transplant
  • Nutrition Care Post Transplant and Long Term Issues
  • Nutrition & Intercurrent Illness
  • Nutrition & Chronic Graft Dysfunction

Second Topic
CSR Test Taking 101
by Patricia Williams, RD, CSR, LDN

  • Review testing procedure and layout
  • Review tips for taking the CSR exam
  • Discuss simulation sample test problem

Product.ProdName: Directing Patient Conversations toward Behavior Change Part 2
Product.Content:
Directing Patient Conversations toward Behavior Change Part 2:  Case Based Learning
Speaker: Kristin S. Vickers Douglas, Ph.D
RPG Members Only

Thursday April 19, 2012 1-2pm CST

Fee: $10 (CPEU approval pending)

Objectives:

  1. To listen for "change talk" in a patient role play.
  2. To learn communication strategies appropriate for a patient ambivalent about behavior change.  
  3. To consider the challenges associated with selecting appropriate goal intensity.
  4. To review the Elicit-Provide-Elicit framework for information exchange. 

Note: You will receive an eblast with call-in and GoToMeetings final steps to completing the webinar registration.  The eblast will be sent 1-3 days before the webinar.
